verses.translation: The Inevitable Reality -
What is the Inevitable Reality?
And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?
Thamud and 'Aad denied the Striking Calamity.
So as for Thamud, they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].

verses.arabic: وَأَمَّا عَادࣱ فَأُهۡلِكُوا۟ بِرِیحࣲ صَرۡصَرٍ عَاتِیَةࣲ
verses.translation: And as for 'Aad, they were destroyed by a screaming, violent wind
verses.transliteration: Wa ammaa 'Aadun fa uhlikoo bireehin sarsarin 'aatiyah

verses.arabic: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَیۡهِمۡ سَبۡعَ لَیَالࣲ وَثَمَـٰنِیَةَ أَیَّامٍ حُسُومࣰاۖ فَتَرَى ٱلۡقَوۡمَ فِیهَا صَرۡعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٍ خَاوِیَةࣲ
verses.translation: Which Allah imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
verses.transliteration: Sakhkharahaa 'alaihim sab'a la yaalinw wa samaaniyata ayyaamin husooman fataral qawma feehaa sar'aa ka annahum a'jaazu nakhlin khaawiyah

verses.translation: Then do you see of them any remains?

verses.arabic: وَجَاۤءَ فِرۡعَوۡنُ وَمَن قَبۡلَهُۥ وَٱلۡمُؤۡتَفِكَـٰتُ بِٱلۡخَاطِئَةِ
verses.translation: And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities with sin.
verses.transliteration: Wa jaaa'a Firawnu wa man qablahoo wal mu'tafikaatu bilhaati'ah

verses.arabic: فَعَصَوۡا۟ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ أَخۡذَةࣰ رَّابِیَةً
verses.translation: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].
verses.transliteration: Fa'ansaw Rasoola Rabbihim fa akhazahum akhzatar raabiyah

verses.arabic: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلۡمَاۤءُ حَمَلۡنَـٰكُمۡ فِی ٱلۡجَارِیَةِ
verses.translation: Indeed, when the water overflowed, We carried your ancestors in the sailing ship
verses.transliteration: Innaa lammaa taghal maaa'u hamalnaakum fil jaariyah

verses.arabic: لِنَجۡعَلَهَا لَكُمۡ تَذۡكِرَةࣰ وَتَعِیَهَاۤ أُذُنࣱ وَ ٰ⁠عِیَةࣱ
verses.translation: That We might make it for you a reminder and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.
verses.transliteration: Linaj'alahaa lakum tazki ratanw-wa ta'iyahaa unzununw waa'iyah

verses.arabic: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِی ٱلصُّورِ نَفۡخَةࣱ وَ ٰ⁠حِدَةࣱ
verses.translation: Then when the Horn is blown with one blast
verses.transliteration: Fa izaa nufikha fis soori nafkhatunw waahidah

verses.arabic: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةࣰ وَ ٰ⁠حِدَةࣰ
verses.translation: And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow -
verses.transliteration: Wa humilatil ardu wal jibaalu fadukkataa dakkatanw waahidah

verses.translation: Then on that Day, the Resurrection will occur,
And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is infirm.

verses.arabic: وَٱلۡمَلَكُ عَلَىٰۤ أَرۡجَاۤىِٕهَاۚ وَیَحۡمِلُ عَرۡشَ رَبِّكَ فَوۡقَهُمۡ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ ثَمَـٰنِیَةࣱ
verses.translation: And the angels are at its edges. And there will bear the Throne of your Lord above them, that Day, eight [of them].
verses.transliteration: Wal malaku 'alaaa arjaaa'ihaa; wa yahmilu 'Arsha Rabbika fawqahum yawma'izin samaaniyah

verses.arabic: یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ تُعۡرَضُونَ لَا تَخۡفَىٰ مِنكُمۡ خَافِیَةࣱ
verses.translation: That Day, you will be exhibited [for judgement]; not hidden among you is anything concealed.
verses.transliteration: Yawma'izin tu'radoona laa takhfaa min kum khaafiyah

verses.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِیَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِیَمِینِهِۦ فَیَقُولُ هَاۤؤُمُ ٱقۡرَءُوا۟ كِتَـٰبِیَهۡ
verses.translation: So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!
verses.transliteration: Fa ammaa man ootiya kitaabahoo biyameenihee fa yaqoolu haaa'umuq ra'oo kitaabiyah

verses.translation: Indeed, I was certain that I would be meeting my account."
So he will be in a pleasant life -
In an elevated garden,
Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near.

verses.arabic: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشۡرَبُوا۟ هَنِیۤـَٔۢا بِمَاۤ أَسۡلَفۡتُمۡ فِی ٱلۡأَیَّامِ ٱلۡخَالِیَةِ
verses.translation: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth in the days past."
verses.transliteration: Kuloo washraboo haneee'am bimaaa aslaftum fil ayyaamil khaliyah

verses.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِیَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَیَقُولُ یَـٰلَیۡتَنِی لَمۡ أُوتَ كِتَـٰبِیَهۡ
verses.translation: But as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record
verses.transliteration: Wa ammaa man ootiya kitaabahoo bishimaalihee fa yaqoolu yaalaitanee lam oota kitaaabiyah

verses.translation: And had not known what is my account.
I wish my death had been the decisive one.
My wealth has not availed me.
Gone from me is my authority."
[Allah will say], "Seize him and shackle him.
Then into Hellfire drive him.

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ فِی سِلۡسِلَةࣲ ذَرۡعُهَا سَبۡعُونَ ذِرَاعࣰا فَٱسۡلُكُوهُ
verses.translation: Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him."
verses.transliteration: Summa fee silsilatin zar'uhaa sab'oona ziraa'an faslukooh

verses.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا یُؤۡمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَظِیمِ
verses.translation: Indeed, he did not used to believe in Allah, the Most Great,
Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.
So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend
Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;
verses.transliteration: Wa laa ta'aamun illaa min ghisleen

verses.translation: None will eat it except the sinners.
So I swear by what you see
And what you do not see
[That] indeed, the Qur'an is the word of a noble Messenger.

verses.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوۡلِ شَاعِرࣲۚ قَلِیلࣰا مَّا تُؤۡمِنُونَ
verses.translation: And it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe.
verses.transliteration: Wa ma huwa biqawli shaa'ir; qaleelam maa tu'minoon

verses.arabic: وَلَا بِقَوۡلِ كَاهِنࣲۚ قَلِیلࣰا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.translation: Nor the word of a soothsayer; little do you remember.
verses.transliteration: Wa laa biqawli kaahin; qaleelam maa tazakkaroon

verses.translation: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
And if Muhammad had made up about Us some [false] sayings,
We would have seized him by the right hand;
Then We would have cut from him the aorta.

verses.arabic: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنۡ أَحَدٍ عَنۡهُ حَـٰجِزِینَ
verses.translation: And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.
And indeed, the Qur'an is a reminder for the righteous.
And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.
verses.transliteration: Wa inna lana'lamu anna minkum mukazzibeen

verses.translation: And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.
And indeed, it is the truth of certainty.
So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
